column2: U.S. Supreme Court agrees to hear Amazon workers' security check case March 3 The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a case that could determine whether companies such as Amazon.com Inc must pay workers for the time they spend waiting to clear security checks at the end of their work shifts.

column2: Buffett opposes Peltz's Pepsi split plan; surveyed investors like LOS ANGELES
column3: March 3 Investor Warren Buffett and some Wall Street fund managers are divided on activist Nelson Peltz's renewed proposal to split PepsiCo Inc's robust snacks division from its beverage business.

column2: PNC subpoenaed over mortgage lending practicesPNC Financial gets DOJ subpoena over payment processors March 3 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  said it had received a subpoena from the U.S. Department of Justice seeking information about its relationship with certain merchant and payment processor customers.  PNC Financial gets DOJ subpoena over payment processors March 3 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  said it had received a subpoena from the U.S. Department of Justice seeking information about its relationship with certain merchant and payment processor customers. March 3 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  said it received federal subpoenas about its lending practices in relation to certain federally backed mortgage loans.PNC Financial gets DOJ subpoena over payment processors March 3 PNC Financial Services Group Inc  said it had received a subpoena from the U.S. Department of Justice seeking information about its relationship with certain merchant and payment processor customers.

WASHINGTON A U.S. advertisement for a movie that sounded like an emergency alert has drawn fines of $1.9 million for media companies Viacom Inc and Comcast Corp's NBCUniversal and ESPN, co-controlled by Walt Disney Co. after viewer complaints.Dish, Disney reach long-term programming deal -report March 3 After months of talks, Dish Network Corp  and Walt Disney Co have reached a long-term programming agreement that allows the No. 2 satellite provider to carry Disney-owned networks such as ABC and ESPN, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday. VLO,Valero Energy CEO Bill Klesse to step down in MayValero Energy CEO Bill Klesse to step down in MayUPDATE 1-Valero Energy CEO Bill Klesse to retire in May HOUSTON, March 3 Bill Klesse, the silver-haired chief executive officer of Valero Energy Corp, the largest U.S. refiner, will retire in May after eight years at the helm, the company announced on Monday.  UPDATE 1-Valero Energy CEO Bill Klesse to retire in May HOUSTON, March 3 Bill Klesse, the silver-haired chief executive officer of Valero Energy Corp, the largest U.S. refiner, will retire in May after eight years at the helm, the company announced on Monday. U.S. refiner Valero Energy Corp  said Chief Executive Bill Klesse will step down in May after eight years at the helm, and will be succeeded by Chief Operating Officer Joe Gorder.UPDATE 1-Valero Energy CEO Bill Klesse to retire in May HOUSTON, March 3 Bill Klesse, the silver-haired chief executive officer of Valero Energy Corp, the largest U.S. refiner, will retire in May after eight years at the helm, the company announced on Monday.
